Adrian Parker wrote:

> What is the distinction between setup() and the constructor? They
> both seem to provide the same functionality (they are both called anew
> before every test method)?

1. setUp() reveals intent better, both on its own and as a counterpart 
to tearDown()

2. set up code in setUp() means JUnit reserves the right to pool 
instances of test case classes if that should ever become useful
